definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Government desire for accurate reporting is understandable.
sentences.chinese: 政府希望准确的报道当然情有可原。

sentences.english: Of course there were extenuating circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这也是情有可原的。
虽然这种反抗情有可原。

sentences.english: This village has its own traditional dress, cuisine, folklore and handicrafts.
sentences.chinese: 露西以她高超的烹调手艺为傲，这是情有可原的。

sentences.english: The circumstances of his marriage, too, were found to admit of much extenuation.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现，他的婚姻情况也是十分情有可原的。

sentences.english: She was pardonably proud of his wonderful cooking.
sentences.chinese: 她夸自己厨艺了得，是情有可原的。

sentences.english: The stevedores are justifiable for they are unable to catch what you say.
sentences.chinese: 装卸工听不懂你的话，情有可原。

definition: see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
